meanings.definition: Resembling ink in color or consistency.
meanings.sent1: The dark, inklike sky signaled the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was so black, it looked inklike under the bright sun.
meanings.sent3: The inklike paint spilled on the canvas, creating a mysterious pattern.
meanings.sent4: The inklike shadows of the night enveloped the city in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The inklike liquid flowed smoothly from the pen onto the paper.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of ink.
meanings.sent1: The artist used an inklike substance to create the detailed drawings.
meanings.sent2: The old parchment had turned yellow with age, resembling the inklike hue of ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent3: The inklike smell of the marker brought back memories of school days.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an inklike quality, deep and rich with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The inklike texture of the fabric made it perfect for the calligraphy project.

meanings.definition: To write or draw with ink.
meanings.sent1: She carefully inklike her signature at the bottom of the contract.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, people would inklike important documents by hand.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to inklike paw prints all over the freshly cleaned floor.
meanings.sent4: The poet would inklike his verses on the pages late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The calligrapher's skilled hand could inklike intricate designs with ease.
